Condition: Birds with body parts in their names
Explanatory text: Body parts include beak, belly, bill, breast, cap, chin, collar, crest, crown, eye, face, head, neck, rump, shoulder, tail, throat, wing
Note:
Include these terms, if you play with:
European expansion: back, leg, toe
Oceania expansion: back, ear, foot, head, mouth, wattle
Asia: brow, nape, vent, wattle
  • The Azure Tit, Willow Tit, and White-Browed Tit-Warbler do not qualify for the Anatomist card: in this case, "tit" comes from an Old English word meaning "small thing."

Americas expansion: brow, ear, foot, head, leg, nape, tuft, wattle

rulings.text: The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon and those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks. Substrings of bird names that coincide with names of body parts do not count toward the bonus when not referring to body parts (e.g., the wing in Burrowing Owl).
On this bonus card "name" refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Condition: Point value of your [bee] token
Birds with completely full nests
Explanatory text: Birds with no egg capacity do not count towards this card
Note:
Count the number of birds that have the maximum possible number of eggs on them, according to their egg limit.
Birds with no egg capacity do not count towards this card–they do not have a full nest.

Condition: Birds worth less than 4 points
Note: Count the birds you played that have a face value of 0, 1, 2, or 3 points.

Condition: For each column that contains birds with 3 different power colors:
Explanatory text: Birds with no power count as white.

Condition: Birds that can live in multiple habitats
Birds with a [flocking] power
Note: Count the birds you played that have the specific symbol shown on this bonus card. The symbol should be on the left-hand side of the bird’s brown power.

rulings.text: A bird with a [flocking] power qualifies for this bonus card regardless of the color of that power despite the specification of brown powers in this bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

Condition: Birds that eat [seed]
Birds that have at least 4 eggs laid on them
Note: Count only bird cards that have 4 egg tokens sitting on them at game end.

Condition: Point value of your [brilliant] token
Birds with geography terms in their name
Explanatory text: Terms include American, Atlantic, Baltimore, California, Canada, Carolina, Chihuahua, Eastern, Inca, Mississippi, Mountain, Northern, Prairie, Sandhill, Savannah, Western
Note:
Include these terms, if you play with:
European expansion: Corsican, Eurasian, European, Moor
Oceania expansion: Australasian, Australian, mallee, New Holland, North, Pacific, plains, sea, scrub, South
Asia: East, forest, Himalaya, India, jungle, marsh, Orient, Philippine, Sri Lanka, West
Americas expansion: Altamira, Amazon, Andes, Antioquia, Brazil, Chiloé, Grassland, Jamaica, Marsh, Meadow, Neotropic, Oasis, Orinoco, Peru, Savanna, Sierra, South, Titicaca, Tropic

rulings.text: The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, including prairie (which is printed on this bonus card only in newer printings), and those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks.
On this bonus card "name" refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Condition: Birds with tucked cards

rulings.text: In games where the Automa has drawn this bonus card, the Automa selects birds that have tucking powers; these powers are precisely those which contain the word "tuck" or "tucked".

Condition: Birds with a food cost of 3 food
Score more if your hummingbirds are close in value. Compare the points values of your highest and lowest tokens. If the difference is:
Birds in your habitat with the fewest birds.
Explanatory text: Ties count.
Note: Count the number of birds you played, in the habitat where you played the fewest birds. If you have two habitats tied for fewest birds, you may still score this bonus. For example, if all of your habitats have 3 birds in them, your habitat with the fewest birds has 3 birds in it.

Condition: Point value of your [emerald] token
Birds with [ground] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [ground] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Condition: Birds that allow you to score or draw bonus cards
Note:
Count how many birds you have that have the symbol shown–birds whose power allows you to draw a new bonus card. In this deck, these birds are:
Indian Vulture
Philippine Eagle
White-headed Duck
Spoon-billed Sandpiper
Greater Adjutant
Red-crowned Crane
Crested Ibis

In addition, there is one bird–the Great Indian Bustard–that allows you to score a bonus card and keep it. That bird also counts for this bonus card.

Condition: In any one habitat:
Explanatory text: Birds with no power count as white.

Condition: Birds with a [predator] power
Note: Count the birds you played that have the specific symbol shown on this bonus card. The symbol should be on the left-hand side of the bird’s brown power.

rulings.text: A bird with a [predator] power qualifies for this bonus card regardless of the color of that power despite the specification of brown powers in this bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

Condition: Birds that eat [fish]
Birds that eat only [invertebrate]
Consecutive birds in [forest] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
These bonus cards each grant points for a long enough sequence, in the corresponding habitat, of consecutive birds with wingspans in ascending or descending order. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat. A sequence may include two or more birds with the same wingspan.

As mentioned earlier, the wingspans of flightless birds are wild: For purposes of these bonus cards, you can assign a flightless bird any wingspan.

For example, if the wingspans of the first 3 birds in your wetland are in ascending order, but the fourth bird in your wetland has a wingspan smaller than the third bird there, the length of your sequence is 3, in which case the Wetland Data Analyst bonus card would grant 3 points.

rulings.text: This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.

Condition: Different nest types in [forest]
Explanatory text: You may count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type.
Note:
For the birds that you played into the habitat specified on this card, count how many different nest types you have.
You may Count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type. For example, a bowl nest, a platform nest, and three star nests can count as 5 different nests.
Birds with no nest do not count as having a nest type.

Condition: Consecutive birds in [forest] with ascending or descending scores
Explanatory text: Each bird's score must be higher than the next. You can go right to left or left to right.
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
Within the specified habitat, these bonus cards each grant points for a sequence of birds that is in ascending or descending order by their point value.
  • The birds in the sequence must be in a continuous line on the board. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat.
  • Numbers need not be consecutive, as long as they are ascending or descending.

Condition: Birds that can only live in [forest]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Condition: Consecutive birds in [grassland] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
These bonus cards each grant points for a long enough sequence, in the corresponding habitat, of consecutive birds with wingspans in ascending or descending order. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat. A sequence may include two or more birds with the same wingspan.

As mentioned earlier, the wingspans of flightless birds are wild: For purposes of these bonus cards, you can assign a flightless bird any wingspan.

For example, if the wingspans of the first 3 birds in your wetland are in ascending order, but the fourth bird in your wetland has a wingspan smaller than the third bird there, the length of your sequence is 3, in which case the Wetland Data Analyst bonus card would grant 3 points.

rulings.text: This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.

Condition: Different nest types in [grassland]
Explanatory text: You may count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type.
Note:
For the birds that you played into the habitat specified on this card, count how many different nest types you have.
You may Count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type. For example, a bowl nest, a platform nest, and three star nests can count as 5 different nests.
Birds with no nest do not count as having a nest type.

Condition: Consecutive birds in [grassland] with ascending or descending scores
Explanatory text: Each bird's score must be higher than the next. You can go right to left or left to right.
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
Within the specified habitat, these bonus cards each grant points for a sequence of birds that is in ascending or descending order by their point value.
  • The birds in the sequence must be in a continuous line on the board. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat.
  • Numbers need not be consecutive, as long as they are ascending or descending.

Condition: Birds named after a person
Explanatory text: Any bird with an 's in its name.

Condition: [hummingbird] spaces that you reached on your hummingbird track
Hummingbird tokens worth at least 4 points
Birds with wingspans over 65 cm
Note: Count the birds you played that have wingspans over 65cm. Wingspans of exactly 65cm do not count toward this bonus.

Condition: Point value of your [mango] token
Sets of the 4 nest types
Explanatory text: Each star nest can be treated as any 1 nest type. No card can be part of more than one set.
Note:
This card is looking for sets of the four nest types among all of your birds. The order and location of the nests do not matter; it only matters that each set includes all four nest types.
Each star nest can be substituted for one nest of any type in one set. For example:
  • a cavity nest, a platform nest, and two stars would be a complete set.
  • two cavity nests, two platform nests, a bowl nest, a ground nest, and two stars would be two complete sets.
  • two bowl nests, two cavity nests, two platform nests, and one star nest count as one set, not two, because the star nest can only be a member of one set.

Condition: Birds with [cavity] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [cavity] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Condition: Birds that eat [wild]
Explanatory text: Any bird that specifically has a [wild] symbol as part of its food cost.

rulings.text: The percentage on this bonus card should be 16\%. (This misprint was corrected in print by February 2020.)

Condition: Birds that have at least 1 egg laid on them
Note: Count only bird cards that have at least 1 egg token sitting on them at game end.

Condition: Birds with wingspans 30 cm or less
Note: Count the birds you played that have wingspans 30cm or less. Wingspans of exactly 30cm count toward this bonus.

Condition: [fish] and [rodent] tokens cached on birds
Note: Count how many fish and rodent tokens you have cached on your bird cards.

Condition: Birds with colors in their names
Explanatory text: Colors include ash, black, blue, bronze, brown, cerulean, chestnut, ferruginous, gold, gray, green, indigo, lazuli, purple, red, rose, roseate, ruby, ruddy, rufous, snowy, violet, white, yellow
Note:
Include these terms, if you play with:
European expansion: coal, grey
Oceania expansion: crimson, orange, pink, rufous, silver, sulphur, tawny
Asia: azure, emerald, fire, olive, plumbeous, teal, verditer, violet

The European Expansion rulebook erroneously includes honey as a term for the Photographer bonus. card. Honey does not count as a color word.

  • Coppersmith Barbet dose not qualify for the Photographer card.

Americas expansion: amethyst, banana, cinnamon, clay-colored, crimson, fire, gilded, hyacinth, orange, rufescent, scarlet, teal, topaz, turquoise, ultramarine, vermilion

rulings.text: The 3-point bonus applies when there are 4--5 qualifying birds on your player mat, not 2--3. (This misprint was corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)

The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks (excluding honey in the European Expansion rulebook---see Honey), and violet. (Violet currently occurs only on the Violet-Green Swallow, which already contains another keyword for this bonus card.) Substrings of bird names that coincide with color names do not count toward this bonus when not referring to colors (e.g., the red in Barred Owl), but see Northern Bobwhite.
On this bonus card "name" refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Condition: Birds with [platform] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [platform] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Condition: Birds that can only live in [grassland]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Condition: Birds that eat [rodent]

rulings.text: This bonus card's condition is "Birds that eat [rodent]", not "Birds that only eat [rodent]", and its clarification text is, "Any bird with a [rodent] symbol. The bird may also eat other kinds of food." (These misprints were corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)

Condition: Columns with a matching pair or trio of nests
Explanatory text: Different columns may (but need not) score using different nest types. Star nests are wild, but each counts only once.
VP: 2 of the same nest in a column: 1[point]; 3 of the same nest in a column: 3[point]
Note:
This bonus card grants points for each column that contains more than one nest of some type. A column is worth 0, 1, or 3 points, according to whether it has 0, 2, or 3 matching nests in that column, respectively. Different columns may (but need not) score using different nest types.

Star nests are wild. A single star nest counts only once; it cannot be used to match 2 different kinds of nests in the same column.

rulings.text: When scoring this bonus card, birds played sideways can count toward a nest type in both of the columns in which they were played. A [star] nest on a sideways bird can count as different nest types in the two columns in which it was played.

Condition: Birds with an egg limit of 2 or less
Explanatory text: You may include birds with no egg capacity.
Note:
Look at the egg limit printed on each bird card, and count the number of birds whose egg limit is 2 or less. You may include birds that do not have an egg limit–their egg limit is zero (less than 2).
For this card, it does not matter whether the birds have eggs on them.

Condition: Point value of your [topaz] token
Bird cards in hand at end of game
Note: Count the bird cards still in your hand at the end of the game.

Condition: Birds that eat [fruit]
Consecutive birds in [wetland] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
These bonus cards each grant points for a long enough sequence, in the corresponding habitat, of consecutive birds with wingspans in ascending or descending order. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat. A sequence may include two or more birds with the same wingspan.

As mentioned earlier, the wingspans of flightless birds are wild: For purposes of these bonus cards, you can assign a flightless bird any wingspan.

For example, if the wingspans of the first 3 birds in your wetland are in ascending order, but the fourth bird in your wetland has a wingspan smaller than the third bird there, the length of your sequence is 3, in which case the Wetland Data Analyst bonus card would grant 3 points.

rulings.text: This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.

Condition: Different nest types in [wetland]
Explanatory text: You may count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type.
Note:
For the birds that you played into the habitat specified on this card, count how many different nest types you have.
You may Count each star nest as any other type or as a fifth type. For example, a bowl nest, a platform nest, and three star nests can count as 5 different nests.
Birds with no nest do not count as having a nest type.

Condition: Consecutive birds in [wetland] with ascending or descending scores
Explanatory text: Each bird's score must be higher than the next. You can go right to left or left to right.
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]
Note:
Within the specified habitat, these bonus cards each grant points for a sequence of birds that is in ascending or descending order by their point value.
  • The birds in the sequence must be in a continuous line on the board. The sequence need not consist of all birds in the habitat, and it need not start or end with the first or last bird in the habitat.
  • Numbers need not be consecutive, as long as they are ascending or descending.

Condition: Birds that can only live in [wetland]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Condition: Birds with [bowl] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [bowl] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Condition: Food remaining in your supply at game end
Note: Count how many unspent food tokens you have at the end of the game. Food cached on birds does not count as part of your supply.

Condition: Birds of the orders Caprimulgiformes and Apodiformes
Explanatory text: Species include chuck-will's-widow, frogmouths, hummingbirds, nighthawks, nightjars, oilbird, owlet-nightjars, pauraque, poorwills, potoos, spinetails, swifts, swiftlets, treeswifts, whip-poor-wills
Note: This card is part of Frogmouth Fan Pack made by TawnyFrogmouth.

Condition: Birds that are worth 3 or 4 points
VP: The automa keeps up to 2 of them (higher value first).

Condition:
DifficultyBirds that are worth
Eaglet2 or 3 points
Eagle3 or 4 points
Eagle-eyed Eagle4 or 5 points
VP: The Automa keeps up to 2 of them (lower value first)

Condition: Birds with “Hummingbird” in their power or name
Birds that are worth 5, 6, or 7 points
VP: The automa keeps the highest valued one.

Condition:
DifficultyBirds that are worth
Eaglet4, 5, or 6 points
Eagle5, 6, or 7 points
Eagle-eyed Eagle6, 7, or 8 points
VP: The Automa keeps the lowest valued one.
